name: Prototype Project Workflow
description: Structured workflow for creating consistent, defensible prototypes through coordinated AI agents

phases.name: Phase 1: Project Foundation
phases.description: One-time setup - establishes shared foundation for all prototypes

steps.name: Business Requirements Gathering
steps.description: Clarify customer needs, business intent, and project purpose

steps.name: Structure Cleanup (Post Business Requirements)
steps.description: Enforce canonical structure after business requirements documentation

steps.name: Design Token Extraction
steps.description: Extract shared CSS design tokens for visual consistency

steps.name: Structure Cleanup (Post Design Tokens)
steps.description: Enforce canonical structure after design token extraction

steps.name: Application Setup
steps.description: Initialize React application, create shared systems structure, and generate landing page
actions: Set up core UI components (confirmation dialog, toast notifications)
Generate landing page with empty state placeholder
userActions: Manually start dev server: npm run dev

phases.name: Phase 2: Prototype Cycle
phases.description: Repeat for each prototype - builds on shared foundation

steps.name: Prototype Research-to-Design
steps.description: Combined BA and UX workflow: gather requirements through discovery, then translate into clear design intent (produces 3 documents)

workflows.name: Workflow 1: Requirements Research (9 steps)
steps: Step 2: Complexity Check (stop if too complex)
Step 4: Understand What to Capture (prototype-specific only)
Step 5: Requirements Q&A via requirements-thinking-with-validation skill
Step 8: Requirements Quality Review via requirements-review skill
workflows.userApprovalGate: After Step 9 - user must approve requirements before proceeding to Workflow 2

workflows.name: Workflow 2: Design Intent (18 steps)
steps: Step 5: Document Tasks as User Stories
Step 12: Identify Common vs Custom Controls
Step 16: Review Design Documentation Quality via requirements-review skill
Step 17: Document Design Intent for Handoff
Step 18: User Approval of Design Documents
workflows.userApprovalGate: After Step 18 - user must approve both design documents

mandatoryCaptures: Prototype Purpose - why it exists, what decision/learning it supports
Relationship to Business Goals - how prototype supports business objectives
Assumptions - areas where decisions based on incomplete information
Success Signals - observable outcomes if prototype succeeds
notes: This agent combines both requirements and design workflows
User must approve requirements before design workflow begins
User must approve both design documents before handoff
Agent will stop user if module is too complex and suggest splits

steps.name: Structure Cleanup (Post Prototype Design)
steps.description: Enforce canonical structure after prototype research-to-design completion

steps.name: Prototype Implementation
steps.description: Build the prototype based on all requirement documents

activities: Review existing shared components for reuse
Build new shared components in prototypes/shared/components/
Follow CSS guidelines and design tokens

userActions: Start dev server (if not running): npm run dev

steps.name: Code Review & Compliance Gate
steps.description: Strict code review against specifications and rules with automated fix orchestration
reviewDimensions: Specification Adherence - missing, incorrect, or extra behavior
Rule Compliance - explicit evaluation of every rule
Architectural Integrity - layer violations, coupling errors, responsibility leaks
Code Quality - readability, duplication, hidden complexity
Safety & Risk - error handling, edge cases, security issues
Maintainability - change cost, clarity of intent, future extensibility

activities: Compile Problem List with IDs if verdict ≠ Acceptable
Provide explicit instruction: Fix only listed problems
Define success criteria: Each problem ID resolved, no new violations
workflow.conditional: Only if Problem List items exist

constraints: Preserve existing behavior unless violating a rule

handoff.context: This is a corrective pass, not a redesign
handoff.output: Updated code with Problem ID → Fix mapping

behavioralConstraints: Do NOT merge review and build roles
Surface ambiguity, do not resolve silently

steps.name: Validation & Revision
steps.description: Address issues found during user testing
workflow: Agent fixes issues in tightly scoped changes
steps.focus: One round of feedback and fixes per prototype

completionCriteria: Prototype research-to-design complete (3 documents: requirements, design brief, user verification tasks)
Landing page updated with prototype link
notes: This cycle is independent for each prototype
Shared components may be created/updated during implementation
Foundation elements (tokens, business requirements) are reused, not recreated

managedSkills.name: Requirements Thinking Partner (Validated & Traceable)
managedSkills.purpose: Help users express requirements naturally through informal conversation while ensuring formal, complete, traceable output
managedSkills.timing: During requirements gathering phase (before creating requirement documents)
managedSkills.output: Formal Requirements Summary (5 sections: Overview, Confirmed Decisions, Constraints & Rules, Assumptions, Open Questions)
managedSkills.invocation: Agents use the Skill tool during their workflow
managedSkills.approach: Informal conversational Q&A with formal structured output

managedSkills.name: Requirements Review
managedSkills.purpose: Review requirements documents against established rules and framework guidance, report issues clearly and concisely
managedSkills.timing: After creating requirement or design documents, before presenting to user for approval
managedSkills.invocation: Agents use the Skill tool during their workflow

orchestrationRules: Strict Ordering: No agent may start before its dependencies are complete
One Active Agent at a Time: Do not interleave agent conversations
Skill Invocation: Skills are invoked by agents, not by the orchestrator directly
Document Handoffs: Each agent's output is treated as immutable input for the next agent
No Shortcuts: If a user attempts to skip an agent, stop and redirect
Multiple Prototypes: Foundation work is reused, prototype cycles are isolated
User Approvals: Requirement documents must be explicitly approved before proceeding
Manual Server Start: Dev server must always be started manually by user, never automatically
failureConditions: An agent output is missing or unclear
